meanings.definition: Causing or prompting an action or event
meanings.sent1: The instigative behavior of the child led to a fun game of tag.
meanings.sent2: Her instigative remarks sparked a lively debate among the students.
meanings.sent3: The instigative squirrel kept stealing nuts from the other animals, causing laughter in the forest.
meanings.sent4: His instigative nature was like a spark in a dry forest, igniting excitement wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The instigative music at the party made everyone get up and dance.

meanings.sent1: The instigative group was always coming up with new pranks to play on each other.
meanings.sent2: The instigative plot of the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent3: The instigative cat kept knocking things off the table, much to the amusement of its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her instigative smile was like a secret signal to start the mischief.
meanings.sent5: The instigative atmosphere in the room made everyone feel mischievous.
